DOC.brief_summary: The aim investigator study investigate whether posteriorly direct ( AP ) pressure laterally direct ( LAT ) glide , cause blood pressure heart rate elevation lower patient neck pain . The answer advance investigator understand manual therapy work .
DOC.brief_title: Cardiovascular Response Two Manual Techniques Neck Pain
DOC.detailed_description: To include study , subject unilateral non-traumatic , non-chronic neck pain ( operationally define neck pain mobility deficit last less 3 month ) shall numeric pain rating scale ( NPRS ) 0 5 10 painful neck movement even passive scapular elevation , neck disability index ( NDI ) 16 50 100 % , rest systolic diastolic blood pressure 90/60 138/88 , rest heart rate 60 90 . Subjects exclude current smoker , 50 year age , history fainting spell loss consciousness , blood thinner , take medication history diabetes mellitus , neurologic cardiovascular disease , history spinal surgery , neck pain classify associate headache , radiate pain , movement coordination impairment . A convenience sample subject randomly allocate 1 2 group . Both Group 1 : AP Group 2 : LAT receive posterior pressure lateral glide respectively one hypomobile segment . Baseline NPRS , NDI collect initial visit . Systolic blood pressure ( SBP ) heart rate ( HR ) measure OMRON automatic monitor record time point : ( 1 ) 5 minute , ( 2 ) 7 minute lie supine ; ( 3 ) 1st set , ( 4 ) 5th set one glide , ( 5 ) 2 minute time point # 4 , ( 6 ) 4 minute time point # 4 . After time point # 6 , global rating change ( GROC ) immediately collect base painful neck movement . A finger pulse oximeter place subject ' index finger constantly monitor pulse rate slow heart rate asystole . The primary author perform one technique subject . After one visit , follow-up NPRS , NDI collect .
DOC.criteria: Unilateral , nontraumatic , nonchronic mechanical neck pain Numeric pain rating scale 05/10 painful neck movement ( passive scapular elevation ) Neck Disability Index 1650/100 percent Resting blood pressure 90/60 138/88 mmHg Resting heart rate 60 90 beat per minute Current smoker Under 18 year 50 year age History fainting spell loss consciousness Currently blood thinner Taking medication history diabetes mellitus , neurologic cardiovascular disease History spinal surgery Has neck pain classify associate headache , arm pain , trauma/whiplash
